column5: Hours to get back into the us with only a card? Interesting, only took me and bro 5min with a drivers lc and birth certificate to get back into us...this is the type of bs I've been trying to tell people isn't the case, for about 12yrs. U guys believe what u want, I already know the facts, the world is flat btw
You keep beating your chest that you know. If you believe us all to know nothing, let us find out the hard way.

I'VE been using my passport ever since THEY said we needed one 2009 or 2010 it really doesn't matter when. I'VE had 0 issues at the border. But I'm going to take the scissors and cut mine up because Lmbkiller says i dont need it.............GET REAL !!!

I was referring to a passport card. No trouble at all over the last 5 years. And to reinforce, you DON'T NEED A PASSPORT TO GO TO CANADA AND BACK!!!!! If you are a US Citizen, the HAVE to let you back in! All of this **** about hours of hassle is BS. Call the guard shack in International Falls and the one in Fort Frances. Ask them. I did. Had a friend whose passport expired and he didn't figure that out until the day before we left. ZERO issues. You must have an extensive criminal history to get held up like that.
Lmbkiller is there some way you could reconfigure the keyboard on your phone so it doesn't generate odd symbols when you use an apostrophe for contractions?
He does that on purpose !!!
Bawahahahaha PjShorthorn

What??? The world is flat??? Ok, now we all know you are truly delusional. It is impossible that the world is flat. If it were, cats would have pushed everything over the edge by now. "Your blade, will not Keal!" Doug Marcaida
Ontario is opening in 3 phases, each phase is 4 weeks, The border opening for tourism is the last phase. The 1st phase hasn't even started yet. Do some math

Entry into Canada: Canadian law requires that all persons entering Canada carry both proof of citizenship and proof of identity. A valid U.S. passport, passport card,NEXUS card, Enhanced DL or Real ID satisfies these requirements for U.S. citizens. Children under 16 need only present proof of U.S. citizenship.
Is your passport a book or a card ?

Let's keep to the facts. Ontario Premier Doug Ford did not say each phase was 4 weeks, he repeatedly stated that the plan is a roadmap, not a calendar. Each phase will be assessed before going on to the next phase, there is no specific time frame.
Not according to the Toronto Star article
A book or a card are pretty much the same, The book is better for International travel, Card is great for travel to Mexico or Canada

You can't fly internationally, even to Canada or Mexico with the card. Need the book for that. As far as driving, you truly don't need one. I didn't read the entire string, but I talked to customs officers in International Falls and Fort Frances. Birth certificate and drivers license is totally fine each way.

Card is great to Get In to Canada. Coming back US Customs Will let you back into US on a Card BUT A lot of times you spend Hours at the Border being Checked out before being let back into the US. With a Passport No Trouble at all You Buzz right thru the border check
I view news articles as worse than nothing at all. Only raw news for this guy.
You can read what Prov1800 posted today then lol
You know you have a passport too....it's OK, you can admit it. Don't break your arm patting yourself on the back.....geezzzz. PjShorthorn

When we approached Canadian customs last year everyone in the truck removed their sunglasses and handed passports and ID up to me. I rolled down all the windows in the truck, presented the ID's answered a couple of questions and entered Canada. Don't know if a Passport was required or not. I do know we needed one to get back into Minnesota.
He told you didn't he ?.......LOL.

I know U.S. citizens can cross back into the U.S. with only a drivers license and a birth certificate, because I've seen it many times. That doesn't mean it will always be a pleasant or swift process. Twice members of our group have been detained while the border agents looked into their citizenship. The 1st time they delayed us about 45 minutes while they checked him out. He had to sit inside while we waited outside. Everyone was polite and professional with no problems besides the delay. The second time it was a 2 1/2 hour delay. This time the guy from our group was confrontational and combative, much like your response, and the border agents responded in kind. Since then the rule for our group is if you don't have a passport you drive on your own. The guy who was detained bragged for a couple months about how he wrote his senator and there would be "**** to pay for those nazi border guards". We know from his wife that he received a response, but since he never shared it with us I can only assume his senator didn't agree with him.
Rum dum? I resemble that remark!
Why is this even a topic? Border won't be open till at least Aug
Are you sure about that ?

Yeah I got a passport, I travel by air internationally, has nothing to do with crossing Canadian border by land, good try though. Yeah I will be combative, u don't get to call someone out like I was, then dismiss the consequences when u find out your wrong. And if that's ok with how u operate then u can pound sand and I'm over it
Might not have to wry this year about having a dr license or passport no sense in getting to wild about this topic

You, combative? I don't see you coming across that way at all. You are more of a comedian than anything else. BUT, ouchie bro, you did hurt my feelings by telling me to go pound sand Don't go hanging out with any rum dums.....nothing good will come from it....LMAO. PjShorthorn

I am in the same boat, submitted mine in late February, check cashed within 2 days, and have not received the renewed passport. On our trip of 6 guys, three have passport renewal or applications in process and we are supposed to go June 20. I plan to call the state dept next week if they are not received and see if I can get someone on the phone and get their guidance. Back up plan at this point is to take a birth certificate and driver's license.

You can also enter Canada at the land crossing with an Enhanced Driver's License. Available at the following states Michigan, Minnesota, New York, Vermont and Washington. You will not require to have your birth certificate if you have an EDL. You can also use a NEXUS card or a FAST (Free and Secure Trade) card. to cross the border as a form of citizenship and ID If flying into Canada, you must have a passport.
I have heard getting into Canada isn't the issue. It will be coming back into the US without a passport or card.Brett

There is zero chance of LESS restrictive border conditions any time soon going in either direction. Our Govt has taken a lot of flak over the border for maybe the first time ever in the past year. Your's attitude towards it goes without saying.
Wife and I sent our old US passports in with our applications to renew. Check was cash by them on 3/17/20. Nothing yet.

Maybe so, that also means less chance of seeing any of the tourism dollars that cross the border. There are plenty of resorts in Minnesota, Wisconsin, and Michigan who won't be complaining this year, and, if the fishing is decent, for many years.

According to this website you need a passport to enter Canada from the US only if entering by air, if by land or water you need proof of citizenship and photo ID:https://www.tripsavvy.com/americans-...canada-1481664
Well if thats the case why did i and alot of others go crazy over 10 years ago trying to get a passport to get into CANADA ??

I did the same thing in 2009, ran out and got a passport when I heard it was needed. I guess if the border reopens soon we'll find out if a passport is really needed because a lot of us don't have a valid passport and it's going to be months for the US govt to process renewal applications.

U guys went and bought them cuz u took the bait. Next time do some extensive research. I said a passport wasn't needed for land travel many many yrs ago, for to and home, got slammed on here over and over that I was wrong. I wouldn't have said what I said if I didn't make a call to homeland security that told me exactly what I relayed. Jokes on u rum dums now

I'm another that is on the outside looking in. Turned my renewal in with more than enough time to receive my new one for the opener. I also checked the website and the status said processing, it's been like that for the past two weeks. The rub for me is it doesn't sound like we are going to get them anytime soon but they cashed my check two days after they received my application .
Here is a suggestion for everyone who has a passport. Take a photo of the passport and keep it on your phone.

That might be a good idea but you have to send in your existing passport, book and card, when you renew, which I did in February. But, I have no idea if I'll get new one in time for trip. I find it hard to believe that the countries will allow border crossings without the passport.... I only requested card if that speeds things up at all.
If you don't call the borders you will never know what they will require to get into Canada or back in the US once it is open for tourists. PjShorthorn

I called the US Customs agent in Pembina and they told me they have not heard of any directives on how to approach this situation coming from Washington as of yet. Sounds like what may work at one border crossing may not work at another or on a different day. One thing they did sound sure about is they will not rely on the fact that you crossed the border in years past.

To enter Canada at a land border crossing, all you need is proof of citizenship and proof of identity. A birth certificate and government issued photo ID, like a drivers license. Heading home the the USA over a land border port of entry, yes technically you need to provide a passport. However, I spoke directly with a US border agent in International Falls. He told me they would not deny a US citizen entry into the USA IF they can provide proof of citizenship and proof of identity. May take some more time to sort it out rather than with a passport, but you will get home.
I have never tried that, but have heard the same on Walleye Central from people who have crossed both ways with only a regular driver's license.

2 years ago I was not sure my re newed passport would be in my possession in time for a Canada Trip. I called Fort Francis and they said I would be able to get in and back out with my EXPIRED PASSPORT. #1. Doesn't say much for the actual expiration date.#2. Old passport is usually sent in upon renewal.
Been saying it for 12yrs, u don't need a passport to get into Canada, u don't need a passport to get back into the US
we had a guy use drivers license and birth certificate and he got no hassle from either side of the border. Passports kick in when traveling via air to Canada
Anybody else have their trip in jeopardy with the State Department being pretty much closed?
My wife's enhanced license expired in March and mine will in a few weeks. Not sure if that will be a problem or not since we can't renew now. That's if we can even cross the border in June.
Even if Canada would let us in on an expired passport I'm still out of luck since the State Department has it.
You're in a tougher spot than we are then. Good luck!
I'm. in same boat. Was supposed to receive April 21, website says it will be months before they issue any .

I am in same boat....or lack there of. Fortunately I still have my passport in hand, although I doubt if the restriction is lifted they would make an exception for expired passports. Tough situation. It's really going to suck if the border opens back up, and I don't have a valid passport to let me into Canada.

My son needed one so we literally went to our local government passport services office on March 16th - the LAST day they took applications! We turned it in and they cashed the checks on the 20th. The US Passport center says they would not be processing any applications after March 20th! When we look at the status of receiving the passport it says "In Process" Thus, we will wait and see when arrives. Our Canada trip is in July. Crossing fingers & toes on both having possession of the passport and the border being OPEN!!

Mine expires soon however the State of Michigan has published that expired Enhanced DL's will be automatically extended. Typically you don't need special IDs's to get into Canada but you do to get back to US. The Department of Homeland Security requirement for Real ID's has been extended to October 1, 2021. If you have gotten a new DL lately perhaps you already have a Real ID which is as good as a Passport at the Canadian Border.

I have no solid information to back up my gut reaction on what would happen in the event ,that when the border does open, passports could not have been renewed in time. Having said that.... I think that it is very likely when the border opens back up that we will be able to use old passport information, driver licenses and/or birth certificates ( ala the old days) to gain entry to Canada and the US on the way home. The entire world has had to adjust in so many ways already that this type of issue will be just another adjustment that will be figured out ( hopefully not on the fly) with safety and security in mind. I'm not in the same position, but I do have friends who are and I can completely understand that stress is added just thinking about the what ifs when the border does open. Work on pulling together copies of birth certificates, call the border security offices for both countries and let's all hope for the best. Stay positive and strong. PjShorthorn
Last Sep one guy forgot his passport, used driver's license to get in/out, no problem. (Drove in/out) Bill
